title: World map leak

properties.name: description
properties.value: The World map leak was a mysterious area of land that briefly appeared on the official World map during 2006.

content:
The RuneScape Wiki also has an article on: rsw:World map leak
 World map leak was removed after an update.
As the contents of this page no longer exist in Old School RuneScape, this article is preserved for historical purposes.
This topic name is not found in-game.
While the name or title of this topic is not officially recognised in-game, the information contained on this page is still considered to be canon and is based on official sources.
World map leak
Released20 September 2004 (Update)
Also calledGreenland
MembersYes
LocationTirannwn
MusicNone
Map

The World map leak was a mysterious area of land that briefly appeared on the official World map during 2006.

The area was first added to the game in 2004 with the release of Regicide; it is unknown what purpose it was intended to serve. Possibly, it may have been a placeholder for a future continent associated with the Elf quest series. Some have speculated it was used for Jagex moderators for testing content before release.

According to Mod Ash a fully green square was the default setting in the tool used to create maps, suggesting that the developer made very little progress beyond a rough sketch of the coastline.[1]

Before its removal in 2006, the map's internal version number was still 1, showing it had never been updated during its existence.

Appearance on the world map and removal[edit | edit source]

The area had remained hidden from the World map for several years. This was due to the fact that, along with several other areas like Dragontooth Island, it was not present on the custom file that was used to create the World map. The usage of such files was inefficient however, as they had to be manually created each time, meaning the map could go many months without being updated. Despite this, the area remained in the game with each new map creation, demonstrating that Jagex moderators were fully aware of the area's existence.

On 4 July 2006, the ingame World map was updated to be directly rendered from the game files. While this revealed the whole map, it inadvertently caused the mysterious area to appear, resulting in much speculation as to its purpose.

A hidden system update occurred the next day, permanently deleting the area from the game with no acknowledgement. The reasons behind its creation, 21 month presence ingame, and ultimate removal are still unknown to this day.

References[edit | edit source]

  1. ↑ Jagex. Mod Ash's Twitter account. 12 September 2019. (Archived from the original on 21 April 2021.) Mod Ash: "Looks to me like two mapsquares in their default (plain grassland) state, with someone painting a bit of sea with a broad paintbrush on the east, then getting bored and stopping, then someone accidentally uploading it with the elf land update."

The '''World map leak''' was a mysterious area of land that briefly appeared on the official [[World map]] during 2006. 

The area was first added to the game in 2004 with the release of [[Regicide]]; it is unknown what purpose it was intended to serve. Possibly, it may have been a placeholder for a future continent associated with the [[Elf quest series]]. Some have speculated it was used for Jagex moderators for testing content before release.

According to [[Mod Ash]] a fully green square was the default setting in the tool used to create maps, suggesting that the developer made very little progress beyond a rough sketch of the coastline.{{CiteTwitter|author=Mod Ash|url=https://twitter.com/JagexAsh/status/1172056072808542208|quote=Looks to me like two mapsquares in their default (plain grassland) state, with someone painting a bit of sea with a broad paintbrush on the east, then getting bored and stopping, then someone accidentally uploading it with the elf land update.|date=12 September 2019|archiveurl=https://archive.is/kAYph|archivedate=21 April 2021}}

Before its removal in 2006, the map's internal version number was still 1, showing it had never been updated during its existence.

==Appearance on the world map and removal==
The area had remained hidden from the World map for several years. This was due to the fact that, along with several other areas like [[Dragontooth Island]], it was not present on the custom file that was used to create the World map. The usage of such files was inefficient however, as they had to be manually created each time, meaning the map could go many months without being updated. Despite this, the area remained in the game with each new map creation, demonstrating that Jagex moderators were fully aware of the area's existence.

On 4 July 2006, the ingame World map was updated to be directly rendered from the game files. While this revealed the whole map, it inadvertently caused the mysterious area to appear, resulting in much speculation as to its purpose.

A hidden system update occurred the next day, permanently deleting the area from the game with no acknowledgement. The reasons behind its creation, 21 month presence ingame, and ultimate removal are still unknown to this day.
